alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 3:02PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY PRECIPITATION EXPECTED LATE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY... A storm is expected to bring another 1 to 2 inches of rainfall to a large portion of the Alaskan Panhandle with the highest totals for the northern and central outer coasts. The heaviest rain is expected late Tuesday night over the NE gulf coast then push S through Wednesday. The airmass will be warm enough for precipitation to fall as rain, the exception would be along the Haines and Klondike highways. Initial estimates of 3 to 5 inches possible near the borders. The forecast will continue to be refined as more details become available. Stay tuned for additional statements regarding this storm.
